news_summary: Advancements in sustainable energy, AI innovation, and cutting-edge materials are driving significant progress and investment in technology today.
news_summary_fr: Les progrès en matière d'énergie durable, d'innovation dans le domaine de l'intelligence artificielle et de matériaux de pointe sont aujourd'hui à l'origine d'avancées et d'investissements considérables dans le domaine de la technologie.
news_summary_es: Los avances en energía sostenible, la innovación en inteligencia artificial y los materiales de última generación están impulsando importantes progresos e inversiones en tecnología en la actualidad.

articles.title: Rust-based battery connects to an electricity grid for the first time
articles.summary: An iron-air battery in the Netherlands, which can store energy for 100 hours or more to make renewable power sources more consistent, has become the world’s first “rust” battery to connect with an electricity grid
articles.content:
An iron-air battery in the Netherlands, which can store energy for 100 hours or more to make renewable power sources more consistent, has become the world’s first “rust” battery to connect with an electricity grid

A rust-based battery system is stored in standard 12-metre shipping containers Ore Energy

An iron-air battery that stores and releases energy through a reversible rusting process has become the first of its kind to connect with a public electricity grid. On 30 July, the Dutch start-up Ore Energy announced its batteries had connected to the grid at Delft University of Technology in the Netherlands.

Batteries can help deliver a consistent supply of electricity by storing renewable energy from solar or wind farms, releasing it when necessary to ensure that a sudden change in sunlight or wind doesn’t mean an immediate drop in available electricity.

Advertisement

“You need to be able to store that excess energy when the wind is blowing and the sun is shining, to be able to deploy it when you need to during critical demand periods during the day,” says John-Joseph Marie at The Faraday Institution, a battery research body in the UK. “Essentially, batteries can help to smooth out that power output to make it usable on the grid.”

Many grid-connected batteries are now lithium iron phosphate ones manufactured in China. But they typically hold power for just 4 to 6 hours and are prohibitively expensive, says Marie. In contrast, the iron-air batteries developed by Ore Energy can store power for 100 hours or longer and are made from cheap and widely available materials.

“Iron is the most mined metal in the world, it’s incredibly cheap,” says Marie. “And when you combine that with air, which is literally all around us and basically free, those are almost the two cheapest components that you could find.”

Free newsletter Sign up to The Earth Edition Unmissable news about our planet, delivered straight to your inbox each month. Sign up to newsletter

The system charges and stores energy by using electricity to convert iron oxides – a form of rust – into metallic iron. The iron can then discharge or release its stored energy by chemically reacting with oxygen from the air to form rust again.

“When the battery is discharging, we are actually taking the iron and turning it into a special type of rust,” says Aytac Yilmaz, CEO of Ore Energy. “And when we are charging the battery, we are taking the rust back into iron, and we do this over and over again [while] the battery is breathing in and out the oxygen from atmospheric air.”

The batteries are stored in standard 12-metre shipping containers and can store multiple megawatt-hours of energy – with 1 megawatt-hour being enough to supply more than a month of electricity to a typical US home.

Separately, the Massachusetts-based company Form Energy has several iron-air battery projects in the works in the US. They are slated for installation in New England and the Midwest.

In addition to iron and air, such batteries incorporate water-based electrolytes that are also cheap and abundant – not to mention greatly reducing the risk of battery fires. “I wouldn’t want to be the one to say never, but you can’t set fire to water,” says Marie.

But the main goal of the battery technology is to help renewable power sources replace fossil fuels in electricity grids.

“Energy companies still rely a lot on gas-fired [power] generation to provide the flexibility needed when wind and solar are not sufficient,” says Bas Kil, business development manager at Ore Energy. “But in the long term we will need a different type of flexibility, and that is where our battery really excels – to provide this multi-day flexibility.”
articles.reasoning: The article describes a scientific breakthrough in energy storage technology that can enhance the reliability of renewable energy sources, contributing positively to environmental sustainability and energy innovation.
articles.personality_title: Rust battery connects to power grid, boosting renewable energy storage
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context**
In the Netherlands, a new type of battery using iron and rust offers a fresh way to store energy. This technology tackles a big challenge: renewable energy, like solar and wind, doesn’t always produce power steadily.

**What happened**
For the first time, an iron-air battery that stores energy by rusting and unrusting iron connected to a public electricity grid. This battery can hold energy for over 100 hours, using a safe and affordable process inside shipping containers.

**Impact**
This breakthrough means cleaner energy can be saved and used when the sun isn’t shining or the wind isn’t blowing. It helps make green power sources more reliable and could reduce our reliance on fossil fuels.

**What's next step**
The team will focus on expanding this technology and improving its efficiency. If successful, rust batteries could become a common and cost-effective way to support renewable energy worldwide.

**One-sentence takeaway**
A rust-based battery just proved it can store and deliver clean energy reliably, marking a major step for renewable power.
articles.personality_title_fr: Une batterie à base de rouille connectée au réseau électrique, un coup de pouce pour le stockage d’énergie renouvelable
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Contexte**
Aux Pays-Bas, une nouvelle batterie utilisant le fer et la rouille propose une façon innovante de stocker l’énergie. Cette technologie répond à un grand défi : l’énergie renouvelable, comme le solaire et l’éolien, n’est pas toujours constante.

**Ce qui s’est passé**
Pour la première fois, une batterie fer-air qui stocke l’énergie en rouillant et déroutant le fer s’est connectée à un réseau électrique public. Cette batterie peut conserver l’énergie plus de 100 heures, grâce à un procédé sûr et abordable dans des conteneurs maritimes.

**Impact**
Cette avancée signifie que l’énergie propre peut être sauvegardée et utilisée quand il n’y a pas de soleil ou de vent. Elle rend les sources vertes plus fiables et pourrait réduire notre dépendance aux énergies fossiles.

**Prochaine étape**
L’équipe va se concentrer sur l’extension de cette technologie et l’amélioration de son efficacité. Si elle réussit, les batteries à base de rouille pourraient devenir une méthode courante et économique pour soutenir les énergies renouvelables dans le monde.

**En résumé**
Une batterie à base de rouille a prouvé qu’elle peut stocker et fournir de l’énergie propre de manière fiable, marquant une étape importante pour les énergies renouvelables.
articles.personality_title_es: Batería de óxido de hierro conecta a la red eléctrica, impulsando el almacenamiento de energía renovable
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**Contexto**
En los Países Bajos, una nueva batería que usa hierro y óxido ofrece una forma innovadora de almacenar energía. Esta tecnología aborda un gran reto: la energía renovable, como la solar y eólica, no siempre genera electricidad de forma constante.

**Qué pasó**
Por primera vez, una batería de hierro-aire que almacena energía oxidando y desoxidando el hierro se conectó a una red eléctrica pública. Esta batería puede guardar energía durante más de 100 horas, usando un proceso seguro y económico dentro de contenedores marítimos.

**Impacto**
Este avance significa que la energía limpia puede almacenarse y usarse cuando no hay sol o viento. Hace que las fuentes verdes sean más confiables y podría reducir nuestra dependencia de los combustibles fósiles.

**Próximo paso**
El equipo se enfocará en ampliar esta tecnología y mejorar su eficiencia. Si tiene éxito, las baterías de óxido podrían convertirse en una forma común y rentable de apoyar la energía renovable en todo el mundo.

**Conclusión en una frase**
Una batería de óxido de hierro demostró que puede almacenar y entregar energía limpia de forma confiable, marcando un gran avance para la energía renovable.
articles.image_prompt: A warm, detailed painting of glowing, rust-colored iron blocks inside open shipping containers gently breathing with soft, airy swirls representing oxygen, set against a peaceful Dutch university campus backdrop with stylized wind turbines and solar panels in natural earthy tones, symbolizing the iron-air battery seamlessly connecting to a clean, renewable electricity grid.

articles.title: Meta profits surge helps drive Zuckerberg’s AI ambitions
articles.summary: The Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp-owner is pumping billions of dollars into artificial intelligence projects.
articles.content:
Meta profits surge helps drive Zuckerberg’s AI ambitions

Meta says the cost of building infrastructure, including servers and data centres, and workers' pay packages will be its biggest expenses.

At the same time expenses are also rising - up 12% to $27bn - as the company ploughs money into fulfilling chief executive Mark Zuckerberg’s AI ambitions, and its spending is expected to keep rising.

The firm - which owns Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp - says revenue for the three months to the end of June rose 22% from the same period last year to $47.5bn (£35.86bn), while profits jumped by 36% to $18.3bn.

Social media giant Meta Platforms says its profits soared and it is pumping billions of dollars more into artificial intelligence (AI) projects.

Before Meta's earnings announcement on Wednesday, Zuckerberg posted a video on Instagram describing his plans for developing what he called "AI Superintelligence" that surpasses "human intelligence to solve complex problems".

He also said Meta will create "personal superintelligence" that uses advanced AI for everyday tasks such as helping users remember things like wedding anniversaries and then making reservations or ordering a gift.

Mike Proulx from research and advisory firm Forrester said Meta is helping "future-proof itself as a growth company" in the event that its current offerings falter.

Meta has been seeking to catch up with rival artificial intelligence developers like OpenAI and Google after the release of Llama 4 family of large language models (LLMs) left some users and investors disappointed.

It has offered $100m pay packages to top AI talent to lure them away from competitors.

Meta has also spent more than $14bn on a stake in artificial intelligence firm ScaleAI and brought in its chief executive Alexandr Wang to help spearhead its efforts.

Zuckerberg’s strategy has been to use the strength of Meta's core businesses to help fund its AI projects.

He said 3.4 billion people around the world use at least one Meta app every day.

Meta has also deployed AI to improve its advertising business.

But the the cost of developing superintelligence have raised concerns among some analysts.

"AI-driven investments into Meta's advertising business continue to pay off, bolstering its revenue as the company pours billions of dollars into AI ambitions like superintelligence,” said Minda Smiley from market research firm Emarketer.

“But Meta's exorbitant spending on its AI visions will continue to draw questions and scrutiny from investors who are eager to see returns,“ she added.

Meta's shares jumped by more than 10% in extended trading in New York after its earnings announcement.
articles.reasoning: The article highlights Meta's increased profits fueling significant investment in artificial intelligence projects, which suggests progress in technology that could solve real problems and drive innovation. While it does not specify direct benefits to ordinary people yet, the focus on AI ambitions is generally seen as positive and hopeful for future advancements.
articles.personality_title: Meta’s rising profits fuel bold AI dreams
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context**
Meta, the company behind Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp, has been investing heavily in artificial intelligence (AI). This technology helps computers learn and make decisions, aiming to improve services and create new possibilities.

**What happened**
Meta’s profits have surged, giving the company more money to spend on AI projects. Their biggest costs include building data centers and paying employees, but they’re willing to invest big. Their expenses rose 12% to $27 billion as they focused on CEO Mark Zuckerberg’s AI vision.

**Impact**
This funding boost means Meta can push forward with developing smarter, more helpful technologies. While everyday users haven’t yet seen direct changes, these investments could lead to better apps and tools in the future, improving how we connect and share.

**What's next step**
Meta plans to keep increasing spending on AI, building more infrastructure and hiring talent. Their goal is to turn AI ambitions into real products that benefit users worldwide.

**One-sentence takeaway**
Meta’s growing profits are powering exciting AI advancements that promise to shape the future of technology and how we interact online.
articles.personality_title_fr: Les bénéfices en hausse de Meta alimentent ses ambitions en IA
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Contexte**
Meta, la société derrière Facebook, Instagram et WhatsApp, investit beaucoup dans l’intelligence artificielle (IA). Cette technologie permet aux ordinateurs d’apprendre et de prendre des décisions, avec pour but d’améliorer les services et de créer de nouvelles possibilités.

**Ce qui s’est passé**
Les bénéfices de Meta ont augmenté, donnant à l’entreprise plus de moyens pour financer des projets d’IA. Ses plus grandes dépenses incluent la construction de centres de données et les salaires des employés, mais elle est prête à investir massivement. Les dépenses ont augmenté de 12 %, atteignant 27 milliards de dollars, pour suivre la vision IA du PDG Mark Zuckerberg.

**Impact**
Cette augmentation de financement permet à Meta de faire avancer le développement de technologies plus intelligentes et utiles. Bien que les utilisateurs n’aient pas encore vu de changements directs, ces investissements pourraient améliorer les applications et outils à l’avenir, facilitant nos connexions et partages.

**Prochaine étape**
Meta prévoit d’augmenter encore ses dépenses en IA, en construisant plus d’infrastructures et en recrutant des talents. Son objectif est de transformer ses ambitions en IA en produits concrets pour les utilisateurs du monde entier.

**Une phrase clé**
Les bénéfices croissants de Meta stimulent des avancées prometteuses en IA qui vont transformer l’avenir de la technologie et nos interactions en ligne.
articles.personality_title_es: Las crecientes ganancias de Meta impulsan sus ambiciones en IA
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**Contexto**
Meta, la empresa dueña de Facebook, Instagram y WhatsApp, está invirtiendo mucho en inteligencia artificial (IA). Esta tecnología ayuda a las computadoras a aprender y tomar decisiones, buscando mejorar servicios y crear nuevas posibilidades.

**Qué pasó**
Las ganancias de Meta han aumentado, dándole más dinero para proyectos de IA. Sus mayores gastos incluyen construir centros de datos y pagar empleados, pero están dispuestos a invertir mucho. Los gastos subieron un 12% a 27 mil millones de dólares, siguiendo la visión de IA del CEO Mark Zuckerberg.

**Impacto**
Este aumento en fondos permite a Meta avanzar en tecnologías más inteligentes y útiles. Aunque los usuarios aún no ven cambios directos, estas inversiones podrían mejorar aplicaciones y herramientas en el futuro, facilitando cómo nos conectamos y compartimos.

**Próximo paso**
Meta planea seguir aumentando el gasto en IA, construyendo más infraestructura y contratando talento. Su meta es convertir sus ambiciones en IA en productos reales que beneficien a usuarios en todo el mundo.

**Una frase clave**
Las crecientes ganancias de Meta están impulsando avances emocionantes en IA que prometen moldear el futuro de la tecnología y nuestra interacción en línea.
articles.image_prompt: A detailed painting of a glowing, intricate network of interconnected digital nodes and servers shaped like a stylized brain, symbolizing advanced AI superintelligence, with abstract silhouettes of people using smartphones and tablets nearby, connected by soft, warm light threads representing Meta’s apps and global reach—all rendered in gentle earth tones and muted blues to evoke innovation and optimism.

articles.title: The Gulf bets big on AI as it seeks the 'new oil'
articles.summary: The UAE and Saudi Arabia are partnering with the US to position themselves as AI hubs.
articles.content:
The Gulf bets big on AI as it seeks the 'new oil'

6 hours ago Share Save Sameer Hashmi Business Correspondent Reporting from Dubai Share Save

Khazna The UAE wants to become a hub for AI

When Donald Trump touched down in the United Arab Emirates (UAE) earlier this year, he arrived not just with headlines, but with deals, ambition, and AI firepower. The US president was given a royal welcome, but the real centrepiece of the visit was the announcement of a sprawling new AI campus - a joint UAE-US initiative. Billed as the largest AI infrastructure hub outside the US, it symbolised the Gulf's boldest bid yet to plant itself at the heart of the global AI map. Trump's visit to the Gulf also coincided with a strategic shift, which saw the White House easing restrictions on exporting the most powerful microchips from US firm Nvidia to both the UAE and Saudi Arabia. This move underscored how much the US now sees its Gulf allies as partners in a wider technological alliance. The Gulf states are deploying their sovereign wealth, geography, and energy edge (lots of oil) to position themselves as AI hubs. Technology is central to their plans to reduce future dependence on earnings from fossil fuels.

The UAE, in particular, is leading the charge. And data centres lie at the heart of this effort. Abu Dhabi has announced a massive data centre cluster for OpenAI and other US firms as part of the "Stargate" project. The multibillion dollar deal is being funded by G42, an Emirati state-linked tech firm driving the country's AI ambitions. Nvidia will supply its most advanced chips. Tech giants Cisco and Oracle, along with Japan's SoftBank, are also working with G42 to build the first phase. "Just like Emirates helped turn the UAE into a global hub for air travel, now the UAE is at a stage where it can become an AI and data hub," says Hassan Alnaqbi, CEO of Khazna, the UAE's largest data centre operator. Khazna, which is majority owned by G42, is building the infrastructure for Stargate. The company currently operates 29 data centres across the UAE.

WAM Trump and UAE president Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan unveiled a model of the AI campus

The UAE and Saudi Arabia want to host the data centres needed to train powerful AI models. "Compute is the new oil," says Mohammed Soliman, senior fellow at the Middle East Institute in Washington DC. In the context of AI, compute refers to the vast processing power enabled by high-end chips and large-scale data centres - the kind the Gulf is now investing billions to build. In today's AI-driven world, infrastructure is the new fuel - in the same way oil was in the industrial age. Mr Soliman says that just as Gulf-based oil companies powered the global economy in the last century, AI firms in the region now want to offer "compute" to power the global economy of the 21st.

Gulf sovereign funds have poured billions into foreign tech giants in recent years. But now, they are pivoting from being passive investors to more active players. In Saudi Arabia, the Public Investment Fund (PIF) has launched a national AI company - Humain - which plans to build "AI factories" powered by several hundred thousand Nvidia chips over the next five years. In the UAE, state-owned investment firm Mubadala has backed G42 and MGFX - a $100bn (£75bn) AI-focused joint venture with Microsoft - and other homegrown initiatives.

Khazna Hassan Alnaqbi says the Gulf's location between Asia and Europe gives it an advantage

However, attracting highly-skilled AI talent remains a significant challenge. To address this, the UAE is wooing overseas companies and researchers with low taxes, long-term "golden visas", and lighter regulation. "Building world-class digital and AI infrastructure will act as a magnet," says Baghdad Gherras, founder of a UAE-based AI start-up and a venture investor. Currently, the region has yet to produce a globally recognised AI company like OpenAI, Mistral, or DeepSeek, and it still lacks a deep bench of world-class research talent. Mr Gherras points to the UAE's small population - just over 10 million - as a limiting factor in building a large-scale research ecosystem.

The emergence of Gulf states as ambitious AI players has brought the US-China tech rivalry to the forefront in the desert. Trump's visit gave Washington a strong lead in the region's AI race - but at a cost. As part of its strategic pivot, the UAE has scaled back some China-backed projects and reduced its reliance on Huawei hardware. The emphasis on AI deals during Trump's visit underscores the growing strategic importance of the technology to US diplomacy. Traditionally, the US-Gulf relationship has centred around oil-for-security. But the dynamic is now shifting toward energy, security - and tech.

Khazna Khazna currently operates 29 data centres across the UAE

At the Middle East Institute, Mr Soliman says the AI deals signed during Trump's visit "are more about China than about the Gulf". "It's basically us trying to bring a promising, rising AI region - which is the Gulf - into the American AI stack, to be on Team America AI," he says. The "AI stack" refers to the full pipeline of AI capability: chips, infrastructure, models, and software - mostly dominated by US companies. Mr Gherras says choosing the US over China was a rational choice. "At this stage the Americans are ahead in the AI game. So, it made sense for the UAE to bet on them," he says.
articles.reasoning: The article highlights strategic partnerships and investments in AI by the UAE and Saudi Arabia, aiming to become AI hubs. This represents technological progress and economic development, which can lead to innovation and improved opportunities for citizens.
articles.personality_title: Gulf countries team up with the US to become AI powerhouses
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context**
The United Arab Emirates (UAE) and Saudi Arabia have long been known for their oil wealth. Now, they are shifting their focus to a new valuable resource: artificial intelligence (AI). Both countries want to build strong AI industries to drive their economies forward.

**What happened**
Earlier this year, during a visit by then-US President Donald Trump to the UAE, the two countries announced a major partnership to create a large AI campus. This joint effort with the US aims to bring together technology experts, businesses, and researchers to develop AI innovations.

**Impact**
By investing in AI and partnering with global leaders, the UAE and Saudi Arabia hope to create new jobs, boost their economies, and lead in cutting-edge technology. This move promises fresh opportunities for citizens beyond traditional oil industries.

**What's next step**
The Gulf countries will continue building their AI hubs by supporting startups, training skilled workers, and encouraging innovation. These efforts will help them become international leaders in AI and prepare their economies for the future.

**One-sentence takeaway**
The Gulf is betting big on AI to become the next source of wealth and innovation, moving beyond oil to build a high-tech future.
articles.personality_title_fr: Les pays du Golfe s'associent aux États-Unis pour devenir des leaders de l'IA
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Contexte**
Les Émirats arabes unis (EAU) et l'Arabie saoudite sont connus pour leur richesse pétrolière. Aujourd'hui, ils se tournent vers une nouvelle ressource précieuse : l'intelligence artificielle (IA). Ils veulent développer de fortes industries d'IA pour faire avancer leur économie.

**Ce qui s'est passé**
Au début de l'année, lors d'une visite de l'ancien président américain Donald Trump aux EAU, les deux pays ont annoncé un partenariat important pour créer un grand campus d'IA. Cette collaboration avec les États-Unis vise à réunir experts, entreprises et chercheurs pour développer des innovations en IA.

**Impact**
En investissant dans l'IA et en s'associant avec des leaders mondiaux, les EAU et l'Arabie saoudite espèrent créer de nouveaux emplois, dynamiser leur économie et devenir des pionniers du domaine technologique. Cela ouvre de nouvelles opportunités pour leurs citoyens, au-delà du pétrole.

**Prochaine étape**
Les pays du Golfe continueront à développer leurs pôles d'IA en soutenant les startups, en formant des travailleurs qualifiés et en encourageant l'innovation. Ces actions les aideront à devenir des leaders internationaux de l'IA et à préparer leur économie pour l'avenir.

**Phrase-clé**
Le Golfe mise sur l'IA pour devenir la prochaine source de richesse et d'innovation, en allant au-delà du pétrole pour construire un futur high-tech.
articles.personality_title_es: Los países del Golfo se asocian con EE.UU. para convertirse en potencias de la IA
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**Contexto**
Los Emiratos Árabes Unidos (EAU) y Arabia Saudita son conocidos por su riqueza petrolera. Ahora, están enfocándose en un nuevo recurso valioso: la inteligencia artificial (IA). Ambos países quieren construir industrias sólidas de IA para impulsar sus economías.

**Qué pasó**
A principios de este año, durante una visita del entonces presidente de EE.UU., Donald Trump, a los EAU, los dos países anunciaron una gran asociación para crear un campus masivo de IA. Este esfuerzo conjunto con EE.UU. busca reunir a expertos, empresas e investigadores para desarrollar innovaciones en IA.

**Impacto**
Al invertir en IA y asociarse con líderes globales, los EAU y Arabia Saudita esperan crear nuevos empleos, fortalecer sus economías y liderar en tecnología avanzada. Esto promete nuevas oportunidades para sus ciudadanos más allá del petróleo.

**Próximo paso**
Los países del Golfo seguirán construyendo sus centros de IA apoyando a startups, formando trabajadores calificados y fomentando la innovación. Estos esfuerzos los ayudarán a ser líderes internacionales en IA y a preparar sus economías para el futuro.

**Una frase clave**
El Golfo apuesta fuerte por la IA para convertirse en su próxima fuente de riqueza e innovación, superando el petróleo y construyendo un futuro tecnológico.
articles.image_prompt: A detailed, warm painting of a golden desert landscape at sunset with stylized, glowing data centers shaped like futuristic oil rigs rising from the sand, connected by radiant circuits flowing like rivers of light toward a large, abstract chip resembling a shining “new oil” source, all rendered in soft earth tones and gentle blues, evoking innovation and transformation.

articles.title: Author Correction: Dual interfacial H-bonding-enhanced deep-blue hybrid copper–iodide LEDs
articles.summary: Nature, Published online: 30 July 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09443-8Author Correction: Dual interfacial H-bonding-enhanced deep-blue hybrid copper–iodide LEDs
articles.content: Thank you for visiting nature.com. You are using a browser version with limited support for CSS. To obtain the best experience, we recommend you use a more up to date browser (or turn off compatibility mode in Internet Explorer). In the meantime, to ensure continued support, we are displaying the site without styles and JavaScript.
articles.reasoning: The article discusses a scientific correction related to enhanced deep-blue hybrid copper–iodide LEDs, which suggests progress in LED technology. Advances in LED technology can lead to more efficient, sustainable lighting solutions, benefiting society and the environment.
articles.personality_title: New improvements boost deep-blue LED technology with copper–iodide
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context**
Scientists are working to make LED lights brighter, more efficient, and environmentally friendly. Deep-blue LEDs, which produce a strong blue light, are important for screens and lighting but have been challenging to improve.

**What happened**
Researchers corrected and enhanced their understanding of a new type of deep-blue LED that uses a hybrid copper–iodide material. They discovered that adding special hydrogen bonds at two places on the material’s surface helps the LED work better.

**Impact**
These hydrogen bonds improve how the LED emits light, making it brighter and more energy-efficient. This means devices using these LEDs could last longer and use less power, benefiting both consumers and the environment.

**What's next step**
The next goal is to apply this discovery to create even better LED designs and explore real-world uses in screens and lighting. Researchers also plan to continue refining the materials to boost performance further.

**One-sentence takeaway**
A simple bonding tweak in copper–iodide LEDs is lighting the way to brighter, greener technology for the future.
articles.personality_title_fr: De nouvelles améliorations renforcent la technologie des LED bleu profond au cuivre–iode
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Contexte**
Les scientifiques cherchent à rendre les lampes LED plus lumineuses, efficaces et respectueuses de l'environnement. Les LED bleu profond, qui produisent une lumière bleue intense, sont importantes pour les écrans et l'éclairage, mais leur amélioration est complexe.

**Ce qui s'est passé**
Les chercheurs ont corrigé et amélioré leur compréhension d'un nouveau type de LED bleu profond utilisant un matériau hybride cuivre–iode. Ils ont découvert qu'ajouter des liaisons hydrogène spéciales à deux endroits de la surface du matériau améliore son fonctionnement.

**Impact**
Ces liaisons hydrogène améliorent l'émission de lumière des LED, les rendant plus lumineuses et économes en énergie. Cela signifie que les appareils utilisant ces LED pourraient durer plus longtemps et consommer moins d'énergie, au bénéfice des consommateurs et de l'environnement.

**Prochaine étape**
L'objectif suivant est d'appliquer cette découverte pour créer des designs de LED encore meilleurs et d'explorer des usages concrets dans les écrans et l'éclairage. Les chercheurs prévoient aussi de continuer à affiner les matériaux pour améliorer encore la performance.

**Une phrase à retenir**
Une simple amélioration des liaisons dans les LED cuivre–iode ouvre la voie à une technologie plus lumineuse et plus écologique pour l'avenir.
articles.personality_title_es: Nuevas mejoras impulsan la tecnología de LED azul profundo con cobre–yodo
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**Contexto**
Los científicos trabajan para hacer que las luces LED sean más brillantes, eficientes y ecológicas. Los LED azul profundo, que producen una luz azul intensa, son importantes para pantallas e iluminación, pero han sido difíciles de mejorar.

**Qué pasó**
Los investigadores corrigieron y mejoraron su comprensión de un nuevo tipo de LED azul profundo que usa un material híbrido de cobre–yodo. Descubrieron que agregar enlaces de hidrógeno especiales en dos lugares de la superficie del material ayuda a que el LED funcione mejor.

**Impacto**
Estos enlaces de hidrógeno mejoran la emisión de luz del LED, haciéndolo más brillante y eficiente en energía. Esto significa que los dispositivos con estos LED podrían durar más y consumir menos energía, beneficiando a los usuarios y al medio ambiente.

**Próximo paso**
El siguiente objetivo es aplicar este descubrimiento para crear diseños de LED aún mejores y explorar usos reales en pantallas e iluminación. Los investigadores también planean seguir perfeccionando los materiales para aumentar el rendimiento.

**Una frase clave**
Un pequeño ajuste en los enlaces del cobre–yodo LED está iluminando el camino hacia una tecnología más brillante y verde para el futuro.
